edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands

Class GitAdd

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands.GitAdd

  • public final class GitAdd
extends java.lang.Object
    GitAdd provides an interface for adding files or directory tree into git repository

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds list of files to the index.
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitAddOptions options, java.io.File file)
      This command adds the current content of new or modified file to the index, thus staging that content for inclusion in the next commit.
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitAddOptions options, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      This command adds the current content of new or modified files to the index, thus staging that content for inclusion in the next commit.
      GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      Adds list of files to the index with no options set.
      GitAddResponse addDryRun(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      This command just executes <git-add> in dry run mode.
      GitAddResponse addVerbose(java.io.File repositoryPath, java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
      This command adds the current content of new or modified files to the index, with verbose option set.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                 GitAddOptions options,
                 java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          JavaGitException
        This command adds the current content of new or modified files to the index, thus staging that content for inclusion in the next commit.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - The path to the repository to commit against. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        options - GitAddOptions that are passed to the <git-add> command.
        paths - List of file paths that will be added to the index.
        Returns:
        GitAddResponse Response generated by the add command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown if -
        • repositoryPath is not valid
        • filenames assigned do not exist
        • files or repository path does not have access rights
        JavaGitException - Exception thrown
        • if the repositoryPath is null.
        • if the <git-add> command generates error.

      • addVerbose

        This command adds the current content of new or modified files to the index, with verbose option set.

        paths - List of file paths that will be added to the index.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown if -
        • repositoryPath is not valid
        • filenames assigned do not exist
        • files or repository path does not have access rights
        JavaGitException - Exception thrown
        • if the repositoryPath is null.

      • addWithForce

        public GitAddResponse addWithForce(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                          java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   JavaGitException
        This command adds the current content of new or modified files to the index, with Force option set i.e. it adds the ignored files as well.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - The path to the repository to commit against. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        paths - List of file paths that will be added to the index.
        Returns:
        GitAddResponse Response generated by the add command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown if -
        • repositoryPath is not valid
        • filenames assigned do not exist
        • files or repository path does not have access rights
          • JavaGitException - Exception thrown
          • if the repositoryPath is null.
          • if the <git-add> command generates error.

      • addDryRun

        public GitAddResponse addDryRun(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                       java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                JavaGitException
        This command just executes <git-add> in dry run mode.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - The path to the repository to commit against. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        paths - List of file paths that will be added to the index.
        Returns:
        results GitAddResponse from the add command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException could be thrown if -
        • repositoryPath is not valid
        • filenames assigned do not exist
        • files or repository path does not have access rights
        JavaGitException - Exception thrown
        • if the repositoryPath is null.
        • if the <git-add> command generates error.

      • add

        public GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                 GitAddOptions options,
                 java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          JavaGitException
        This command adds the current content of new or modified file to the index, thus staging that content for inclusion in the next commit.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - The path to the repository to commit against. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        options - GitAddOptions that are passed to the <git-add> command.
        file - File to be added to the index.
        Returns:
        GitAddResponse object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown if -
        • repositoryPath is not valid
        • filenames assigned do not exist
        • files or repository path does not have access rights
        JavaGitException - Exception thrown
        • if the repositoryPath is null.
        • if the <git-add> command generates error.

      • add

        public GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                 java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          JavaGitException
        Adds list of files to the index.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - File path pointing to the root of the repository.
        file - File will added to the index.
        Returns:
        GitAddResponse object.
        Throws:
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error while running the add command.
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • access to a file is denied
        • a command is not found on the PATH

      • add

        public GitAddResponse add(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                 java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                   throws JavaGitException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Adds list of files to the index with no options set.
        Parameters:
        repositoryPath - File path pointing to the root of the repository
        paths - List of file paths that are going to be added to the index.
        Returns:
        GitAddResponse object.
        Throws:
        JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error while running the add command.
        java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
        • a directory doesn't exist
        • access to a file is denied
        • a command is not found on the PATH
